name: Social Web App
description: A social web app for users to connect, share content, and interact in real-time.

current_prd.elevator_pitch: Our social web app enables users to connect, share content, and engage in real-time interactions. It solves the problem of fragmented online social experiences by providing a unified platform for posting, liking, commenting, and following others, fostering a vibrant community and personalized content discovery.
current_prd.problem_statement: Users lack a unified and real-time platform for social interaction, content sharing, and personalized content discovery, leading to fragmented experiences across multiple platforms and a desire for more engaging and dynamic online communities.
current_prd.solution: The social web app provides a unified platform for users to sign up, create profiles, share text and image posts, and interact in real-time through likes, comments, and follows. It offers a personalized feed, infinite scroll, and an admin dashboard for content and user management, fostering a dynamic and engaging online community.

key_features.feature_description: Enable user signup/login via email and social authentication (e.g., Google, Facebook).
Allow users to manage their profile information, including bio, avatar, and account settings.
Enable users to create and share posts containing text and images.
Allow users to like and comment on other users' posts.
Provide functionality for users to follow and unfollow other users.
Display a customized timeline of content from users that the current user follows.
Enable real-time updates for posting, commenting, and liking without requiring a page reload.
Implement infinite scrolling for content feeds to provide a seamless browsing experience.
Provide an administrative interface for content moderation, user management, and viewing analytics.

steps: User navigates to the app's login/signup page.
User chooses to sign up with email or a social provider (e.g., Google, Facebook).
If email, user enters email and password, then confirms email (if required).
If social, user authenticates through the chosen social provider.
System creates/authenticates user account and logs them in.
User logs in and navigates to their profile page.
User clicks on 'Edit Profile'.
User updates their bio, uploads a new avatar, or modifies account settings.
User clicks 'Save Changes'.
System updates the user's profile information and displays the updated profile.
User logs in and navigates to the home feed or a dedicated posting interface.
User clicks on a 'Create Post' button.
User enters text and/or uploads images.
User clicks 'Post'.
System publishes the post to the user's profile and followers' feeds in real-time.
User views a post on their feed.
To like, user clicks the 'Like' icon.
System registers the like and updates the like count in real-time.
To comment, user clicks the 'Comment' icon.
User types their comment and clicks 'Submit'.
System publishes the comment to the post and updates the comment section in real-time.
User views another user's profile.
User clicks the 'Follow' button.
System registers the follow relationship and updates the follower count.
The followed user's content now appears in the current user's personalized feed.
To unfollow, user clicks the 'Unfollow' button on a followed user's profile.
System removes the follow relationship and updates the follower count.
User logs in and is directed to their home feed.
System retrieves posts from users the current user follows.
System displays these posts in a chronological or algorithmically sorted order.
As the user scrolls down, the system loads more posts using infinite scroll functionality.
Admin logs into the Admin Dashboard.
Admin navigates to the 'Content Moderation' section.
Admin reviews reported posts or filters content by specific criteria.
Admin can approve, hide, or delete posts.
System updates the content status and notifies the user if their content was actioned.
Admin logs into the Admin Dashboard.
Admin navigates to the 'User Management' section.
Admin searches for specific users or views a list of all users.
Admin can view user profiles, edit user roles, suspend, or delete user accounts.
System applies the changes to the user account and logs the action.
Admin logs into the Admin Dashboard.
Admin navigates to the 'Analytics' section.
Admin views dashboards displaying key metrics such as active users, new signups, popular content, and engagement rates.
Admin can filter data by time period or other parameters.
System displays updated analytical reports.

current_prd.success_metrics: Number of active users, daily/monthly active users (DAU/MAU), user retention rate, average session duration, number of posts created per user, number of likes/comments per post, number of new followers per user, content moderation efficiency (time to resolve reported content), admin dashboard usage.
current_prd.competitors: Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, TikTok, Reddit, LinkedIn, Pinterest, Snapchat.
current_prd.vision: To become a leading social platform that fosters genuine connections, empowers creative expression, and provides a safe and engaging environment for users worldwide, continuously innovating with new features and technologies to enhance the social experience.

target_audience.name: General Social Media Users
target_audience.pain_points: Fragmented social experiences across multiple apps, lack of real-time engagement on some platforms, privacy concerns, overwhelming content feeds, desire for more personalized content discovery.
target_audience.demographics: Ages 16-45, diverse backgrounds, tech-savvy, active on social media platforms.
target_audience.needs_and_goals: Connect with friends and family, share personal updates and content, discover new content and communities, express themselves creatively, stay informed, engage in real-time interactions.

target_audience.name: Content Creators/Influencers
target_audience.pain_points: Difficulty in audience growth, limited engagement tools on some platforms, lack of comprehensive analytics, challenges in content distribution and discoverability.
target_audience.demographics: Ages 18-50, individuals who regularly create and share content (e.g., bloggers, vloggers, artists, musicians), seeking to build an audience and monetize their content.
target_audience.needs_and_goals: Reach a wider audience, engage with their followers, build a personal brand, gain insights into content performance, potentially monetize their content.

phasing.rationale: This phase establishes the fundamental social networking capabilities. Users can register, create a profile, share content, interact with posts, build connections by following others, and view a personalized feed. This is a complete, albeit basic, social experience that is launch-able to early adopters.

Building upon the core functionality, this phase significantly enhances the user experience. Real-time updates make interactions immediate and dynamic, while infinite scroll provides a smooth and engaging content browsing experience. This makes the platform more polished and ready for a broader beta launch.

This phase introduces the necessary tools for platform administrators to manage content, users, and monitor analytics. While not a user-facing feature, it is crucial for the operational health, moderation, and future growth of the social app, making it demo-able to internal teams and stakeholders.

current_prd.design_principles: Engaging and intuitive user interface for social interactions. Real-time responsiveness for content updates. Clean and modern aesthetic with a focus on user-generated content. Mobile-first approach for on-the-go usage.

current_prd.tam_description: Total Addressable Market for the Global Social Media Market, encompassing all revenue generated by social networking platforms worldwide, primarily through advertising, but also including subscriptions and other monetization methods.
current_prd.tam_estimation_basis: Based on global social media market revenue projections for 2023.
current_prd.sam_description: Serviceable Available Market for general social media users and content creators seeking a unified and engaging platform for content sharing, real-time interaction, and personalized content discovery, representing the segment of the global social media market open to new platforms addressing fragmented experiences.
current_prd.sam_estimation_basis: Estimated 75 percent of the TAM, focusing on the broad segment of users and creators actively engaged in social media and potentially seeking improved, unified experiences.
current_prd.sam_source: Analysis of global social media user behavior and market segmentation reports
current_prd.som_description: Serviceable Obtainable Market, representing the realistic market share a new social web app can capture within the Serviceable Available Market over a 5-year horizon, considering the highly competitive landscape dominated by established players and the challenges of user acquisition and retention.
current_prd.som_estimation_basis: Conservative 0.2 percent market share estimate over 5 years, acknowledging significant barriers to entry, network effects of incumbents, and the difficulty of attracting users from established platforms.
current_prd.som_source: Competitive analysis of major social media platforms, historical data on new social app market entry success rates
current_prd.pricing_model_basis: Advertising-based revenue model, with potential for future premium features or creator monetization tools.
current_prd.advantage_summary: Unified platform for content sharing and real-time interaction, personalized content discovery, fostering a vibrant community, addressing fragmented online social experiences.

planned.model_content:
class Post < ApplicationRecord
  belongs_to :user
  has_many :comments, dependent: :destroy
  has_many :likes, dependent: :destroy
  has_one_attached :image

  validates :content_text, presence: true

  rhino_owner :user
  rhino_references [:user]
end

planned.model_content:
class Follow < ApplicationRecord
  belongs_to :follower, class_name: 'User'
  belongs_to :followed, class_name: 'User'

  validates :follower_id, uniqueness: { scope: :followed_id }
  validate :cannot_follow_self

  private

  def cannot_follow_self
    if follower_id == followed_id
      errors.add(:followed_id, "cannot follow yourself")
    end
  end

  rhino_owner :follower
  rhino_references [:follower, :followed]
